page.title: 05Traffic Through Newmillerdam
page.content: The greatest change to the area has been brought about by motor transport. In the past the road from Wakefield to Barnsley was travelled by horse drawn carts. Today a lot of traffic now uses what is now the A6l trunk road. Despite the nearness of the Ml (less than 2 miles to the west) many heavy lorries hurtle through the middle of the area. The problem is made worse because the road bends sharply in the centre of the village to enable it to cross the dam after which the village has been named. There are no pedestrian crossings in the village and on weeek days it is especially difficult to get across the road. Unfortunately there seems little hope of an improvement if the amount of traffic continues to increase.
